explanations.A: Almost! There's a lot going on in statement 2. Look on the right, -q + (-p). What happens when we add a negative? Can we do additions and subtractions in any order?
explanations.B: Almost! Look on the right of statement 1, p + (-q). What happens when we add a negative?
explanations.C: On the right of statement 1 we have p + (-q). Adding a negative is the same as subtracting. So we have p - q which is the same as the left. On the right of statement 2 we have -q + (-p) which is -q - p. Additions and subtractions can be done in any order so this is the same as -p - q
explanations.D: Not quite. For each statement look at the right right hand side first. What happens when we add a negative? Can we do additions and subtractions in any order?
